answers.answer:
In Romania, all medical services and medicines necessary for COVID-19 treatment are covered by the FNUASS for insured persons, uninsured persons, and other individuals diagnosed with COVID-19 on Romanian territory.

To find more detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and read the section titled "Patients with COVID-19."
answers.bResponse:

To find more detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and read the section titled "Patients with COVID-19." For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19

answers.answer:
Yes, all people in Romania who show symptoms of COVID-19 can benefit from remote consultations offered by a family doctor or a specialist doctor.

To find this detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and read under the section titled "Patients with COVID - 19".
answers.bResponse:

To find this detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and read under the section titled "Patients with COVID - 19". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19

answers.answer:
To receive medical services at COVID-19 evaluation centers, individuals must have a confirmed infection via a rapid antigen or NAAT/RT-PCR test identified in the Corona Forms platform, exhibit mild or moderate clinical manifestations of COVID-19, not require oxygen therapy, and have at least two risk factors, without needing a referral note.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and read under the section "Measures for patients with COVID - 19".
answers.bResponse:
To receive medical services at COVID-19 evaluation centers, individuals must have a confirmed infection via a rapid antigen or NAAT/RT-PCR test identified in the Corona Forms platform, exhibit mild or moderate clinical manifestations of COVID-19, not require oxygen therapy, and have at least two risk factors, without needing a referral note.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and read under the section "Measures for patients with COVID - 19". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19

answers.answer:
No, a referral note is not necessary for medical services at COVID-19 evaluation centers for individuals with mild or moderate clinical manifestations, at least 2 risk factors, and no need for oxygen therapy, provided their infection is confirmed and identified in the Corona Forms platform.

To find this detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and look under the section titled "Patients with COVID-19".

answers.answer:
Yes, a specific "Post-Covid-19 Syndrome Evaluation" service has been introduced and can be provided during day hospitalization for patients who continue to present long-term symptoms.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and read the content under the "Patients with COVID-19" section, specifically within the details about medical services provided.

answers.answer:
Yes, individuals with moderate or severe respiratory insufficiency after COVID-19 can obtain devices for continuous oxygen administration, such as oxygen concentrators.

To find detailed information, please visit the website dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and look under the "Medical devices chapter" section.
answers.bResponse:

answers.answer:
Yes, patients with certain conditions may benefit from noninvasive ventilation devices, and this could include those with post-COVID-19 conditions.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and read under the "Medical devices chapter" for specifics on how these devices can be obtained.

answers.answer:
Patients with post-COVID-19 conditions can benefit from physical therapy, psychological counseling, and psychotherapy. These services are available upon the recommendation of cardiology and pneumology specialists.

To find detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and look under the section titled "Patients with COVID-19".

answers.answer:
Yes, physical therapy, psychological counseling, and psychotherapy for post-COVID-19 conditions are covered by the health insurance system, provided they are recommended by cardiology or pneumology doctors and offered by clinics contracted with the health insurance house.

To find detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19` and look under the section titled "Patients with COVID-19". The specific details regarding post-COVID-19 conditions and their coverage are located there.

To find detailed information, go to the website `https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19` and look under the section titled "Patients with COVID-19". The specific details regarding post-COVID-19 conditions and their coverage are located there. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19

answers.answer:
Patients with moderate or severe respiratory insufficiency after COVID-19 or those who passed through a specific triage system may obtain devices for continuous oxygen administration (e.g., oxygen concentrators), and some may also benefit from noninvasive ventilation.

To find detailed information on how to obtain these devices, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and look for the "Medical devices chapter" within the "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system".
answers.bResponse:
Patients with moderate or severe respiratory insufficiency after COVID-19 or those who passed through a specific triage system may obtain devices for continuous oxygen administration (e.g., oxygen concentrators), and some may also benefit from noninvasive ventilation.

To find detailed information on how to obtain these devices, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and look for the "Medical devices chapter" within the "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19

Yes, there is a list of family medicine offices in Bucharest where you can get a COVID-19 vaccination. This list is available for download.

To find this detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/patients-with-covid-19 and navigate to the section titled "Addresses where you can get covid vaccination in Bucharest" where you will find a link to download the list.

To find detailed information, go to the website dopomoha.ro and read under the "Patients with COVID-19" section.
